etymology.description: 知(知) (zhī, "know; be aware") refers to understanding or awareness, and 道(道) (dào, "way; path") signifies a method or principle. Combined, 知道(知道) (zhīdào, "know; aware") conveys the concept of having awareness or knowledge of a particular matter or principle.
etymology.interpretation: In the phrase 知道(知道), the concept of 'knowing the way or principle' is emphasized, reflecting an understanding or awareness of something specific.

examples.chinese: 我知道(我知道)，他明天会来(他明天會來)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhīdào, tā míngtiān huì lái.
examples.english: I know that he will come tomorrow.

examples.chinese: 她一听到消息就知道(她一聽到消息就知道)，结果会很严重(結果會很嚴重)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yī tīngdào xiāoxī jiù zhīdào, jiéguǒ huì hěn yánzhòng.
examples.english: She knew immediately upon hearing the news that the outcome would be very serious.
